text: This is a list of Soviet European Film Award winners and nominees. This list details the performances of Bosnian actors, actresses, and films that have either been submitted or nominated for, or have won, a European Film Award. ==Main categories== {| class="wikitable" width="100%" cellpadding="5" |- !width="5%"|Year !width="18%"|Award !width="28%"|Recipient !width="10%"|Status !width="38%"|Note |- |rowspan="4"| 1988 || Special Aspect Award || Sergei Parajanov for Art Direction in Ashik Kerib || || |- | Special Jury Award || Jurij Chanin for music in The Days of Eclipse || || |- | Best Director || Sergei Parajanov for Ashik Kerib || || |- | European Discovery of the Year || Days of Eclipse || || |- |rowspan="3"| 1989 || Best Film || Little Vera || || |- | Best Director || Vasili Pichul for Little Vera || || |- | Best Actress || Natalya Negoda for Little Vera || || |- |rowspan="3"| 1990 ||European Cinema Society Special Award || Association of Filmmakers of the USSR || || |- | Best Film || Mother || || |- | European Discovery of the Year || Lie Still – Die - Revive || || |- |1992 || European Discovery of the Year || Three Days || || |- |} ==External links== * Nominees and winners at the European Film Academy website ==See also== * List of Soviet submissions for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film Category:Cinema of the Soviet Union Category:European Film Awards Category:Lists of Soviet films Category:Lists of mass media in the Soviet Union
title: List of Soviet European Film Award winners and nominees
